New Records: Wales have won three of their last five home games, including a 2-1 win over Croatia.
Turkey reached the quarter-finals of Euro 2024, their best performance in over 15 years.
Key Match Events: Wales and Turkey have faced each other three times in the last few years, with both sides winning one game each while the other ended in a draw.
Turkey's most recent game was a 2-1 loss to the Netherlands in the quarter-final of Euro 2024.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales are under the guidance of a new manager, Craig Bellamy, who has brought optimism after a perceived stagnation under Rob Page.
Turkey are coming into this match on a high following their best tournament performance in over 15 years under Vincenzo Montella.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales have been unbeaten in their last five home games, excluding penalty shootouts.
Turkey's recent success has created a positive atmosphere around the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be televised live on SC4.
Wales' predicted lineup includes young talents like Lewis Koumas, while Turkey's lineup is expected to be similar to their Euro 2024 squad.
Others: The match is part of the UEFA Nations League.
